title: Neuroscience of Behavior
description: This course examines the biological basis of psychology. Behavioral Neuroscience is an interdisciplinary science that aims to investigate the interaction between brain and behavior. Credit will not be awarded for PSYC 4020 and NEUR 3003.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Cannot be enrolled in one of the following Levels:
__HEADER_1__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: NEUR 2001 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of C or NEUR 2000 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of C or NEUR 2010 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of C
